intro: Parietaria polygonoides, commonly known as the common wall-rocket, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and waste areas. The plant has small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense spikes, and its leaves are heart-shaped with a rough texture. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other mustard family plants. Parietaria polygonoides is often considered a weed but can provide habitat for small invertebrates.
